text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at another family to see how talking about feelings helps them in a practical way:

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, I have 5 minutes to spend one-on-one time with you. What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: Let’s play with the ball outside!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at another family to see how talking about feelings helps them in a practical way:
rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, I have 5 minutes to spend one-on-one time with you. What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: Let’s play with the ball outside!

character_2_text.eng: I see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name. It’s not easy, let’s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.

rows.character_2_text: I see that your hands are tight and you are speaking loudly. It looks like you are upset, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name. It’s not easy, let’s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it.

character_1_text.eng: Five kicks in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name!

rows.character_1_text: Five kicks in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name!

character_1_text.eng: Well done! I am very happy to be able to spend this time with you, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name

rows.character_1_text: Well done! I am very happy to be able to spend this time with you, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s talk this through together. What happened when @data.characters.f3_uncle.name and @data.characters.f3_son_4.name decided to play soccer?

quiz_1_question.eng: Why does @data.characters.f3_uncle.name name @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s feelings when he’s feeling angry?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Not quite. Naming emotions might not make someone feel better right away. The goal is to help him recognize his feelings so he can handle them better next time.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To help @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learn to recognise his own emotions

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name models an important skill.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: To teach @data.characters.f3_son_4.name how to solve problems on his own.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Not really. While solving problems is important, the main goal here is to help @data.characters.f3_son_4.name recognize his emotions. Once he knows what he’s feeling, he’ll be better at solving problems next time.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: To distract @data.characters.f3_son_4.name from what’s bothering him.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Not quite. The goal isn’t to take his mind off his feelings. By naming his emotions, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name is helping @data.characters.f3_son_4.name understand what he’s feeling, so he can deal with it better next time.

quiz_2_question.eng: What can we learn from how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name talks about @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s emotions?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, he does! But he also names @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s difficult emotions. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name shows us that it is important to identify both positive *and* difficult emotions for our children.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: He doesn’t want him to feel frustrated so he ignores it.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Not quite. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name accepts whatever emotions @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s is feeling. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: He uses words to describe @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s emotions

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name shows us how we can talk about positive *and* difficult emotions with our children in a helpful way.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: He hides his own feelings with @data.characters.f3_son_4.name

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: He doesn’t hide his own emotions, he names them. By talking about his own feeling of happiness, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name models how his nephew can do the same.

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Yes, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name shows us that his nephew’s difficult emotions are not something he needs to ignore or be scared of..

quiz_3_question.eng: What would have happened if @data.characters.f3_uncle.name had criticised or ignored @data.characters.f3_son_4.name’s frustration?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng: Incorrect. Without the ability to deal with his feelings, the frustration @data.characters.f3_son_4.name was feeling would have increased.

quiz_3_option_2_text.eng: The same problem would happen again next time

quiz_3_feedback_2.eng: Correct. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn how to deal with their emotions.

quiz_3_option_3_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name would have learned how to catch a ball anyway.

quiz_3_feedback_3.eng: Incorrect. Noticing and naming emotions is very important to support our children and help them learn new skills.
